text: {| |} LÉ Maev was a of the Irish Naval Service. She was named after Medb, the legendary queen of Connacht. She was launched in August 1942 as , and served on the Arctic convoys during World War II. Maev was commissioned into Irish service in December 1946, and decommissioned in March 1972. ==References== Category:Former naval ships of the Republic of Ireland Category:Flower-class corvettes of the Naval Service (Ireland) category:Ships built by Harland and Wolff Category:1942 ships
title: LÉ Maev (02)
